landing_text:
The Critters are a peace-loving, yet unknown colony living in the forest. Lately, a disease has caused some of them to turn into mutants disturbing the peace. Mutated Critters go on a rampage and stop obliging the colony's rules. Since the Critters are unable to distinguish mutants from healthy Critters, they need your help! On the way to a save tower, they behave according to certain rules the mutants ignore. They have developed a device that, when operated correctly, relocates the mutants to a save place until a cure has been found.

Help to save the peace by creating mines that test the Critterâ€˜s properties. If a Critter passes the test, it will proceed to the tower. Increase your score by letting healthy Critters reach home and relocating mutated ones. Decrease your score by letting mutants reach the tower. To help you know the correct behaviour, you are given the rules according to which the Critters behave. Start with the first level or select another level.
registration_successful: Registration successful. Please check your emails to complete registration.
long_data: Username, email or password too long
really_delete_account: Do you really want to delete your account? This process cannot be reversed.
privacy_policy: Code Critters stores your username, password and email address. You always have the option to delete your profile.
fill_fields: Please fill out all the input fields
submit_error: There was an error submitting the data
privacy_text: Code Critters collects only an email address and no other personal information through the user registration page. The email address, together with username and password can be viewed on this profile page. The score data for the individual levels is also stored. Code Critters will not share private information with other companies. Anonymised game data may be used for scientific analysis. Code Critters uses the email address only for authentication, and to allow users to reset their passwords. Code Critters does not actively send any information to your email address. Code Critters uses cookies for logins. The login cookie is deleted when the browser session is closed. This privacy notice was last updated on October 15, 2020. If you have any questions about Code Critters' privacy policy, the data we hold on you, or you would like to exercise one of your data protection rights, please do not hesitate to contact us via email: gordon.fraser@uni-passau.de or via our postal address: Chair of Software Engineering II, University of Passau, Innstrasse 33, D-94032 Passau, Germany.
project_text: The Code Critters project aims at teaching children about mutation testing using a gamification approach. The web application was developed at the University of Passau within the scope of a bachelor's thesis at the chair of Software Engineering II.
reset_password: Please check your email to reset your password.
bad_request: Error submitting data. Please fill out all required fields.
delete_level: Are you sure you want to delete the following level?
delete_row: Are you sure you want to delete the following row?

update_row: Do you really want to update the row name?

error_text: The page you are looking for can not be found or you do not have the right to access the page.
show_mutants_info: On this page, you can check out the code of all mutants for

show_mutants_critter: The Critter tab contains the original code you have to test.
